author: @hansfrankfurter2903
text:
What are the latest most advanced works in Marxist or Marxist friendly anthropology?

I'm also confused about the idea of the historical eventuality and inevitability of socialism/communism. if each society has its own unique experiment , how can we conclude that socialism/communism is the eventuality that history is pushing towards? and if we drop the idea of the eventuality of communism, wouldn't we be stepping back into "Utopianism" and abandoning "scientific socialism".

text:

replies.author: @lavenderandred_
replies.text: Marx's analysis of material conditions was ultimately limited by his material conditions, and it's the case for us too!

author: @lain2006gits
text:
It is not the conclusion, but the method ,of Marxist thinking that allows us to correctly interpret our conditions 

A proletariat does not need to necessarily arise to enact a move towards socialism, but it is the major agent(s) of the foundation of production, whether it be a peasantry , that can be the driving force. 


This shatters the dogmatic conception of the universality of history thought by other Marxists.


At least, I think.
